授業目的: The main goal of this course is to introduce students to the basic concepts of linguistics and knowledge about linguistic diversity via examination of data from various languages.
到達目標: After completing this course students will have acquired basic knowledge into the various subfields of linguistics, and learned how different linguistic features behave cross-linguistically, with an emphasis on Japanese and Korean (but also in relation to other languages).
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Face-to-face classes, interactive class discussions.
Students should be prepared for discussion related to assigned readings.
For students who need online-learning, each lecture will be simultaneously provided by ZOOM.

第1回: Face-to-face class. All students need to read the attached files below ( “The tell tale brain”, “10 myths about language”) and be prepared for the class discussion.
第2回: Face-to-face class. Reading assignment: Chapter 2 of the textbook (p9-19)
トピック.授業計画1: A more detailed schedule will be provided in the first class. Some key sub-areas of linguistics will be covered: phonetics and phonology, morphology, syntax, pragmatics, typology, sociolinguistics, etc..
トピック.授業外学習2: All students are expected to complete the assigned readings before the lecture and be prepared for classroom discussions.
